data.title: Gorica Popović (Actress) - Height, Weight, Age, Movies, Biography, News, Images & Videos
data.meta_description: Gorica Popović is a Serbian theatre, television and film actress.
data.text:
Aporia [18 December 1981]

Baba [2 August 2019]

Battle of Kosovo [1989]

Battle of Kosovo is a 1989 Yugoslav historical drama/war film filmed in Serbia. The film was based on the drama written by poet Ljubomir Simović.

Bloody Tale [1969]

Delirium Tremens [28 February 2019 (Czechia)]

A famous actor is diagnosed with delirium tremens.

Deserter [Peter Kosminsky]

Dorotej [1981]

Dorotheus [Milivoje Miško Milojević]

Draz [1978]

Fragrance of Wild Flowers [1977]

A disgruntled actor meets other fed-up people trying to appear in a film about him.

Glava secera [1991]

Halo taxi [1983]

In the Jaws of Life [4 April 1984 (Yugoslavia)]

In the Jaws of Life is a 1984 Yugoslav film directed by Rajko Grlić. It is based on a novel by Dubravka Ugrešić. The film was released on VHS in the United States by Facets Video in November 1998.

Karađorđe's death [1983]

Karađorđe's death is a 1983 Yugoslavian history drama film, directed by Đorđe Kadijević. The film was written by Danko Popović.

Lica i sudbine [Mina Stamenkovic]

Loving Glances [19 September 2003 (Serbia and Montenegro)]

Looking for romance, a Serbian student (Senad Alihodzic) meets a poor refugee (Ivana Bolanca) through a marriage broker (Milena Dravic).

Made in YU [11 November 2005]

Made in YU, also Made in Yugoslavia is a 2005 Swedish film directed by Miko Lazic.

Mathilde []

Misao [Petar Teslić]

Naslednik []

National Class Category Up to 785 ccm [9 January 1979]

National Class Category Up to 785 ccm is a 1979 Yugoslav comedy film directed by Goran Marković.

Out of the Woods [25 April 2017]

A grandmother gives up urban life to care for her grandchildren.

Ožalošćena porodica [1990]

Peasants [1979]

Početni udarac []

Pod žrvnjem [1990]

Poor Little Hampsters [26 August 2003]

Prkosna delta [1980]

Seljaci [22 February 2001]

Šest dana juna [1991]

Sex-partijski neprijatelj br. 1 [16 July 1990]

Slatko od snova [1998]

Something in Between [1983]

American journalist Eva (Caris Corfman), traveling to Turkey while nursing a broken heart, impulsively stops off in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, to visit her old friend Janko (Predrag Manojlovic). Eva and Janko embark on a passionate affair complicated by his devotion to his work as a surgeon and inability to commit. Meanwhile, Janko's wealthy playboy friend, Marko (Dragan Nikolic), a cinephile who wants to expand his business holdings to the United States, also takes an interest in Eva.… MORE

Stenica [Zdravko Velimirović]

Sve je za ljude [12 November 2001]

The Common Story [29 November 2019 (Austria)]

The Dark Side of the Sun [21 December 1988]

For three days only a young man (Brad Pitt) with a rare skin disease can doff his leather suit and live like an ordinary person.

The End of the War [9 July 1984]

At the end of World War II, a man takes his son to search for and kill the five members of the fascist militia who tortured and killed his wife.

The Fall of Italy [7 July 1981]

The Fall of Italy, is a 1981 Yugoslav war film directed by Lordan Zafranović. It won the Big Golden Arena for Best Film at the 1981 Pula Film Festival.

The Professional [21 May 2003]

The Professional is a 2003 Serbian comedy/drama film, written and directed by Dušan Kovačević and based on his 1990 play of the same name. The film enjoys cult status and is a dark comedic retrospect of the relationship between dissenters and the State Security Service under the regime of Slobodan Milošević.

The Wounds [4 April 2014 (India)]

As Steve Rogers adapts to the complexities of a contemporary world, he joins Natasha Romanoff and Sam Wilson in his mission to uncover the secret behind a deadly, mysterious assassin.

Uoci Bozica [6 January 2016 (Serbia)]

Volim te najvise na svetu [2003]
